main event: On May 29, 1952, in Tipp City, Ohio, two Air Force personnel observed a round or elliptical object moving in the night sky.
interesting points: The object was observed near Spica and moved to Delta Corvis, covering 30Â° of arc in 10 to 15 seconds.
It was observed to travel over 9 to 10 miles in 10 to 15 seconds, emitting a green light and making no sound.
The observers, one of whom was a physicist with the special projects group at WADC, noted that the light from the object faded out in both cases.
The observation was made through 7x50 binoculars and 10 power glasses, indicating a detailed viewing of the object.
The report indicates that there were photographs taken of the object, although they are not present in the provided image.
sighted object: round or elliptical object emitting a green light
